text: Exhaustion of domestic remedies
label: non-argumentative

text: The Government argue that the application is inadmissible since the applicant has failed to exhaust domestic remedies as required by Article 26 (Art. 26) of the Convention.
label: non-argumentative

text: They contend that the applicant has neither applied for indemnity nor complained to the competent judicial authorities and they point out that there is a pending investigation before the Kulp District Administrative Board.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['they tend they', 'applicant apply indemnity number', 'there be investigation']

text: The applicant maintains that there is no requirement that he pursue domestic remedies.
label: non-argumentative

text: He contends that there is no role for him in the present stages of the investigation pending before the District Administrative Board.
label: non-argumentative

text: In any event, since the applicant has claimed that there is an administrative practice of violation of Article 13 (Art. 13) of the Convention and has provided supporting evidence for such a practice, he is not, in his view, required to await the outcome of the criminal investigation process before complaining to the Commission.
label: non-argumentative

text: The Commission does not deem it necessary to determine whether there exists an administrative practice on the part of the Turkish authorities tolerating abuses of human rights of the kind alleged by the applicant, because it agrees with the applicant that it has not been established that he had at his disposal adequate remedies under the state of emergency to deal effectively with his complaints.

events: ['<ORG> refer finding', '<ORG> refer application number', '<ORG> refer other', 'company cerne allegation']

text: While the Government had outlined a general scheme of remedies that would normally be available for complaints against the security forces, the Commission found it significant that, although the destruction of houses and property had been a frequent occurrence in South-East Turkey, the Government had not provided a single example of compensation being awarded to villagers for damage like that suffered by the applicants.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['<ORG> outline scheme', 'Government provide example', 'company pensation award to', 'company pensation award damage', 'damage suffer applicant']

text: In that case, the Commission noted that it was a known fact that there has been destruction of villages in South-East Turkey with many people displaced as a result.
label: non-argumentative

text: Nor had relevant examples been given of successful prosecutions against members of the security forces for the destruction of villages and the expulsion of villagers.
label: non-argumentative

text: The Commission considered that it seemed unlikely that such prosecutions could follow from acts committed pursuant to the orders of the Regional Governor under the state of emergency to effect the permanent or temporary evacuation of villages, to impose residence prohibitions or to enforce the transfer of people to other areas.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['it seem unlikely', 'prosecution follow act company', 'company ld follow act company']

text: It further had regard to the vulnerability of dispossessed applicants, under pressure from both the security forces and the terrorist activities of the PKK, and held that it could not be said at this stage that their fear of reprisal if they complained about acts of the security forces was wholly without foundation.
label: non-argumentative
events: ['it have regard', 'company ld number say stage', 'company plain act']

text: The Commission concluded that in the absence of clear examples that the remedies put forward by the Government would be effective in the circumstances of the case, the applicants were absolved from the obligation to pursue them.
